enum.name: MAV_BOOL
enum.description: Enum used to indicate true or false (also: success or failure, enabled or disabled, active or inactive).

entry.name: MAV_BOOL_FALSE
entry.description: False.

entry.name: MAV_BOOL_TRUE
entry.description: True.

enum.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY
enum.description: Bitmask of (optional) autopilot capabilities (64 bit). If a bit is set, the autopilot supports this capability.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_FLOAT
entry.description: Autopilot supports the MISSION_ITEM float message type. Note that MISSION_ITEM is deprecated, and autopilots should use MISSION_ITEM_INT instead.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_FLOAT
entry.description: Autopilot supports the new param float message type.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_INT
entry.description: Autopilot supports MISSION_ITEM_INT scaled integer message type. Note that this flag must always be set if missions are supported, because missions must always use MISSION_ITEM_INT (rather than MISSION_ITEM, which is deprecated).

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_COMMAND_INT
entry.description: Autopilot supports COMMAND_INT scaled integer message type.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_ENCODE_BYTEWISE
entry.description: Parameter protocol uses byte-wise encoding of parameter values into param_value (float) fields: https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html#parameter-encoding. Note that either this flag or MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_ENCODE_C_CAST should be set if the parameter protocol is supported.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_FTP
entry.description: Autopilot supports the File Transfer Protocol v1: https://mavlink.io/en/services/ftp.html.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_SET_ATTITUDE_TARGET
entry.description: Autopilot supports commanding attitude offboard.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_SET_POSITION_TARGET_LOCAL_NED
entry.description: Autopilot supports commanding position and velocity targets in local NED frame.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_SET_POSITION_TARGET_GLOBAL_INT
entry.description: Autopilot supports commanding position and velocity targets in global scaled integers.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_TERRAIN
entry.description: Autopilot supports terrain protocol / data handling.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_RESERVED3
entry.description: Reserved for future use.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_FLIGHT_TERMINATION
entry.description: Autopilot supports the MAV_CMD_DO_FLIGHTTERMINATION command (flight termination).

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_COMPASS_CALIBRATION
entry.description: Autopilot supports onboard compass calibration.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MAVLINK2
entry.description: Autopilot supports MAVLink version 2.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_FENCE
entry.description: Autopilot supports mission fence protocol.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_RALLY
entry.description: Autopilot supports mission rally point protocol.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_RESERVED2
entry.description: Reserved for future use.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_ENCODE_C_CAST
entry.description: Parameter protocol uses C-cast of parameter values to set the param_value (float) fields: https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html#parameter-encoding. Note that either this flag or MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_ENCODE_BYTEWISE should be set if the parameter protocol is supported.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_COMPONENT_IMPLEMENTS_GIMBAL_MANAGER
entry.description: This component implements/is a gimbal manager. This means the GIMBAL_MANAGER_INFORMATION, and other messages can be requested.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_COMPONENT_ACCEPTS_GCS_CONTROL
entry.description: Component supports locking control to a particular GCS independent of its system (via MAV_CMD_REQUEST_OPERATOR_CONTROL).

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_GRIPPER
entry.description: Autopilot has a connected gripper. MAVLink Grippers would set MAV_TYPE_GRIPPER instead.

enum.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE
enum.description: These values define the type of firmware release. These values indicate the first version or release of this type. For example the first alpha release would be 64, the second would be 65.

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_DEV
entry.description: development release

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_ALPHA
entry.description: alpha release

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_BETA
entry.description: beta release

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_RC
entry.description: release candidate

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_OFFICIAL
entry.description: official stable release

message.name: GLOBAL_POSITION_INT
message.description: The filtered global position (e.g. fused GPS and accelerometers). The position is in GPS-frame (right-handed, Z-up). It is designed as scaled integer message since the resolution of float is not sufficient.
message.field: Altitude (MSL). Note that virtually all GPS modules provide both WGS84 and MSL.
Vehicle heading (yaw angle), 0.0..359.99 degrees. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX

message.name: AUTOPILOT_VERSION
message.description: Version and capability of autopilot software. This should be emitted in response to a request with MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.
message.field: Firmware version number. The field must be encoded as 4 bytes, where each byte (shown from MSB to LSB) is part of a semantic version: (major) (minor) (patch) (FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE).

HW / board version (last 8 bits should be silicon ID, if any). The first 16 bits of this field specify a board type from an enumeration stored at https://github.com/PX4/PX4-Bootloader/blob/master/board_types.txt and with extensive additions at https://github.com/ArduPilot/ardupilot/blob/master/Tools/AP_Bootloader/board_types.txt

Custom version field, commonly the first 8 bytes of the git hash. This is not an unique identifier, but should allow to identify the commit using the main version number even for very large code bases.

Custom version field, commonly the first 8 bytes of the git hash. This is not an unique identifier, but should allow to identify the commit using the main version number even for very large code bases.

Custom version field, commonly the first 8 bytes of the git hash. This is not an unique identifier, but should allow to identify the commit using the main version number even for very large code bases.
UID if provided by hardware (see uid2)
UID if provided by hardware (supersedes the uid field. If this is non-zero, use this field, otherwise use uid)
